result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Gray Gilmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald Gray Gilmer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donald Gray Gilmer was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Katrina Ochle ck# 025197 sent this date. eif
Katrina Ochle ck# 025196 sent this date. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA, SSPD & Jail. eif
filed by ADA Edward Minser. eif
signed by Def 10/5/15. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF:  Donald Gray Gilmer appeared by phone.  Court called at 1:07 p.m.  State files an amended Information.  There is an agreement.  Attorney Andrea recites the agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.   DE pleads Guilty to the amended Ct 2.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- DE sentenced to 9 months in the St. Croix County jail to run concurrent with the DE's sentence in Georgia.  
- 15 days credit for time served
- Huber is granted 
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250 DNA surcharge apply money from 15CV434 
- Money from the bond is to go back to the payor
- 20 days to appeal
Answer to Motion for Forfeiture, dated 9/16/15. Filed by Atty. Andrea. Rec'd via fax. Original in 15CV384. CP
to reset Motion Hearing and set for Plea filed by Atty Andrea. eif
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-06-2015 11:00 am

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Donald Gray Gilmer appeared.  Court called.  DE does not appear.  DE has turned himself in to the Fairfield County Detention Center.  Attorney Andrea was unable to set up the DE's appearance by phone.  Court will set out for Plea/Sentencing.  DE has permission from the court to appear by phone.  Attorney Andrea will make arrangements.  Court adjourned.  lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Filed by ADA Minser. km

Atty Andrea argues bail, Defendant's family can come up with about $2000.00 cash, ADA Minser states Defendant has a warrant out of GA and request bond remain.  Court denies request.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Donald Gray Gilmer appeared from jail. Case called at 9:40 a.m. State files information. Atty. Andrea updates Court, and files motions. Atty. Andrea requests bond modification. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Court reserves request for bond modification.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 04:15 pm.
and NMM to Suppress Statements and Evidence filed by Atty Andrea. eif

Arraignment at 08-24-2015 09:30 am

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes & ADA Megan Kelly, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Donald Gray Gilmer appeared.  Court called at 10:48 a.m. Officer Adam Malein of the Somerset Police Department.  Direct by Megan Kelly.  Attorney Andrea stipulates to the identification of the DE.  Cross by Attorney Andrea.  Re-direct by ADA Megan Kelly.  State's Ex. 1 (DE's Priors) O/R.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Set out for arraignment.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 11:01 a.m.  lw  Arraignment scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Donald Gray Gilmer appeared from jail. Atty Andrea states Defendant can come up with $2,500.00 cash and would like bond modified. ADA Nieskes argues and would like bond to remain or to up it to $10,000.00 cash, Atty Andrea argues. Bond continues in form and amount.
